intro: Cleome chilocalyx, commonly known as the swamp cleome, is a herbaceous plant native to the southeastern United States. It typically grows in wet or moist soils, often found in marshes, swamps, and along the edges of ponds. The plant features alternate, lance-shaped leaves and produces clusters of small, yellowish-green flowers. Its flowering period occurs in late summer to early fall, and it is often grown as an ornamental plant for its foliage. The species is also valued for its ability to thrive in humid environments and its role in supporting local wildlife.
